image.altText: A composite of three women.

items.synopsis: Robodebt Commissioner Catherine Holmes says the disastrous debt recovery scheme "made many people feel like criminals".

title.children: Roughly 443,000 Australians received false Robodebt notices. These are some of their stories

image.altText: Peter Dutton rubs his eye.

items.synopsis: Peter Dutton accuses Anthony Albanese of trying to "unseal" the contents of the confidential chapter in the Robodebt royal commission report, but the prime minister says the Opposition leader is showing no empathy for victims.

title.children: Opposition leader criticises the 'glee' of Labor leaders over Robodebt findings, apologises to victims

image.altText: police inside a barbers hop after two men were shot

items.synopsis: Police sources have told ABC News the victims, a 33-year-old man and a 20-year-old man, are associated with the Bandidos bikie gang, and believe it's a targeted attack.

title.children: Bandidos bikie gang linked to two brothers shot in Sydney's inner west hair salon

image.altText: A player gives another player a send off during a cricket match

items.synopsis: Moeen Ali insists there is no great divide between Australia and England on the field despite Steve Smith taking exception to Jonny Bairstow late on day two at Headingley.

title.children: 'What did you say, mate?: Tensions boil over at Headingley but England insists there's no bad blood in Ashes

image.altText: An aerial shot of a bridge with scores of protesters standing on it, holding signs.

items.synopsis: Residents from communities along the Richmond River have rallied on a bridge where harrowing scenes played out during last year's catastrophe.

title.children: Hundreds of 'invisible' and 'abandoned' flood victims rally on iconic NSW bridge

image.altText: Man wearing red cap and grey shirt sitting in cabin of a small yacht with radio equipment in background.

items.synopsis: A young Queensland sailor has been winched to safety after his small sailboat struck rough weather in the Great Australian Bight during a record attempt.

title.children: Young sailor rescued from 'horrendous conditions' in Great Australian Bight during record attempt

image.altText: Two black and white photographs of two men, one old and one younger, taken in the 1970s

items.synopsis: An inquiry into decades-old suspected gay hate crimes in NSW has highlighted investigative deficiencies, the loss or destruction of evidence and unreliable police record-keeping.

title.children: The uncomfortable question looming large from NSW inquiry into suspected gay hate crimes

image.altText: Warriors and Eels

items.synopsis: Parramatta looks to be feeling the impact of missing three key players to State of Origin, after falling victim to first half Warriors blitz. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.

title.children: NRL live: Warriors blitz Eels in the first half of their crucial clash in Sydney

image.altText: Josh Kelly

items.synopsis: Lachie Keeffe is subbed off for the Giants against Hawthorn, as GWS hold a slim lead at half-time in Sydney. Follow all the live Saturday AFL action via the ScoreCentre.

title.children: AFL live: Giants hold slim lead over Hawks after losing ruckman to hamstring injury

image.altText: Centrelink sign.

items.synopsis: Robodebt Commissioner Catherine Holmes has called out how the narrative of welfare recipient vs taxpayer has been used by all sides of politics for decades to generate political populism, writes Laura Tingle.

title.children: Who is to blame, who lied and who failed to act? A lot of people will face consequences for Robodebt actions

image.altText: An older man sitting in his winery with a glass of wine in hand.

items.synopsis: Prominent winemaker, John Cassegrain says significant financial struggles have forced him to put the winery on the market, but he hopes the family can retain ties to the business.

title.children: Prominent NSW winery to be sold after 40 years in business

image.altText: A man leans against a wooden benchtop in the middle of a tiny home.

items.synopsis: People looking for a career change, women seeking secure housing in later life and professional builders are among those enrolling in tiny home courses.

title.children: Want to build a tiny house out of reclaimed materials? This course fits a lot in

image.altText: A line graph indicating a drop in sea ice.

items.synopsis: This week has seen Earth break or equal its record for the hottest day on four occasions and set new July highs for ocean temperatures. While in the Antarctic, the amount of sea ice is well below that recorded in previous years.

title.children: In May, it seemed like we were in the fourth hottest year on record. It's become worse since then

image.altText: police tape

items.synopsis: The 21-year-old Chester Hill man faces 33 charges after a 20-year-old woman was allegedly assaulted and threatened with physical violence on many occasions.

title.children: Man faces 33 charges after alleged serious domestic violence and animal cruelty

image.altText: A young man in white naval uniform and peaked hat stands smiling with hands behind his back, outside near flags

items.synopsis: At an elite naval school in South Carolina, the first three Australian submariners are graduating from a nuclear training program, in preparation for the first stage of nuclear-powered subs to be delivered under the AUKUS deal.

title.children: 'It was sink or swim': Three Aussie submariners just graduated from an elite AUKUS training program

image.altText: a man sits in bed in a robe and cycling shirt with a remote and cricket bat in hand

items.synopsis: Welcome to the world of power naps and sleep banking as Australian sports fans embark on an endurance event of their own — staying up to watch all the action and then trying to function the next day.

title.children: Need to stay awake to watch the Ashes, Wimbledon and Tour De France? A sleep expert has some tips

image.altText: A black and white photo of a smiling woman sitting behind a desk

items.synopsis: The next time you book yourself in for a cervical screen, spare a thought for the woman who endured a similar procedure every day for 21 years.

title.children: Every day for 21 years, Mary got a vaginal test. Her 'generosity' helped save 'millions of lives'

image.altText: Catherine Holmes speaking on-screen at the Robodebt royal commission

items.synopsis: The Robodebt findings include a lot of legal jargon, as victims ask what the consequences will be for those deemed responsible. Here's a breakdown of how things might play out.

title.children: The Robodebt findings have been handed down – what happens next?

items.synopsis: In the world's first robot-human conference in Geneva, robots say they expect to increase in number, help solve global problems, and will not steal humans jobs or rebel.

title.children: Robots in world's first AI press conference say they won't steal jobs or rebel against humans

image.altText: An older man stands with his arms around the shoulders of a younger man and woman.

items.synopsis: When former ABC Radio presenter Barry Whitehead discovered he had another child he admits he buried his head in his hands and "didn't want to know about it".

title.children: At 68, Barry discovered he had another son and grandkids he'd never met. But there was a tragic twist

image.altText: A woman lying in bed with medications next to her

items.synopsis: Reported cases of respiratory syncytial virus have surged in Australia, with about 70,000 notified so far this year — but how and when is testing done?

title.children: The number of RSV cases is on the rise — how do you get tested?

image.altText: a woman holding her baby

items.synopsis: Her allegations are one of a litany against the hospital after the ABC revealed staff had turned away a baby with a potentially life-threatening condition.

title.children: Aleisha grieved her lost baby for a week. Then a second ultrasound revealed a healthy pregnancy

image.altText: Young man with wavy brown hair, smiles at the camera

items.synopsis: It was just before 1am when Jarrod Davies was escorted out of a nightclub by security. A coroner is investigating why he, and another man three months earlier, died in similar circumstances at the Hobart waterfront.

title.children: Intoxicated and booted out of a waterfront bar, Jarrod's life was about to end

image.altText: people raise their hands as they walk towards a police car

items.synopsis: The 24-year-old may still face the death penalty in Texas after being handed 90 consecutive life sentences.

title.children: US gunman given 90 consecutive life sentences for Walmart mass shooting

image.altText: Three flat face masks wrapped in plastic are hung from a string, showing Putin in front, Prigozhin and Lukashenko behind

items.synopsis: Alexander Lukashenko has projected himself as a key negotiator in bringing the Wagner mutiny to an end, but the Belarusian leader now faces a real risk that his peacemaker deal will unravel and leave him with little power and a backyard full of mutinous mercenaries.

title.children: Two weeks after Russia’s mutiny, the situation between Putin and Prigozhin just gets weirder

image.altText: Picture of children playing in a pool on a summer's day

items.synopsis: Walgett's town pool has fallen into disrepair and is set to close, with elders worried locals might turn to swimming in the toxic river instead.

title.children: Temperatures in this town can hit almost 50 degrees in summer, and now the local pool has closed

image.altText: The back of a womans head with dark hair, she is outside the background is blurred but shows trees and a blue sky

items.synopsis: Eliza didn't know where to turn for help when she found out about her husband's sex addiction. Eighteen months on she is still living with the consequences of the revelation and wants others to know they're not alone.

title.children: Eliza discovered her husband's sex addiction on a family holiday. She wants others to know help is out there

image.altText: An auctioneer raises his arm, standing on a suburban street in front of a small crowd of people.

items.synopsis: A bunch of people waving their hands on a suburban street might sometimes feel like a chaotic and stressful way to land a property. Here's why economists believe the property auctions which are so common in Sydney and Melbourne are still an "efficient" way to land a fair price.

title.children: The auction theory playing out each weekend in Australia's property market

image.altText: Man squats at edge of murky river bank holding a stick and prodding it into the water whilst holding a handgun in his other hand

items.synopsis: There aren't many workplaces that include crocodiles in their work health and safety plans. But in the waterways of the Northern Territory, it is essential.

title.children: With a pistol and stick, Roger guards scientists from crocodiles

image.altText: A bulldozer pushes shrubs over.

items.synopsis: Land clearing has paused at a controversial housing development in Darwin after 11 people were arrested and an emergency injunction was sought.

title.children: Bulldozers stopped at Lee Point after cultural heritage injunction

image.altText: People standing behind cluster bomb shells.

items.synopsis: The United States confirms it will send cluster munitions to Ukraine to help its military push back Russian forces entrenched along the front lines.

title.children: The US will give Ukraine cluster bombs. Here's why they're being sent now

image.altText: A cat being examined by a vet.

items.synopsis: Pet owners around the country are facing difficult choices as the rising cost of living leaves them choosing between their own needs and those of their four-legged friends, as cruelty reports spike.

title.children: 'It's relentless': Animal welfare bodies grapple with demand from struggling pet owners

image.altText: A white man with short brown hair and glasses, wearing a grey hoodie and a cardigan, stands against a graffitied wall

items.synopsis: Having been diagnosed with HIV in the 80s, the Australian artist and queer activist made a crucial alteration to his will that allowed his work to find fame even after he died.

title.children: Faced with an early death from AIDS, this artist made careful plans to ensure his legacy lived on
